--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Moh=
r <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> Usually problems along the lines of "crawl ends a=
fter only a few
crawled 
> files with no obvious error" are due to problems=
 with the crawl's 
> defined scope (regardless of the method of launch). Ha=
ve you customized 
> the scope in a way that perhaps deeper material along =
the paths you are 
> crawling is being ruled out, by pattern, site, hops-co=
unt, or something 
> else?
> 
> If you it in fact crawled anything, your me=
thod of launching must be 
> working.
> 
> The mode of launching has change=
d a lot for 2.0.0, so your code would 
> likely need some updating. OTOH, m=
ore options for remote-controlling
the 
> crawling 'engine' without any Web=
 UI at all are available, so it might 
> be an interesting upgrade for you =
from any 1.X version.
> 
> Still, if it's working for you *except* ending f=
aster than expected, 
> it's probably a configuration issue rather than som=
ething a new version 
> would fix.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>

.the crawl ends after only a few crawled files with no obvious
error.
